column6: for 147 years]]) was planted by King [[Tarondor (King of Gondor)
column7: Tarondor]]. It was the third and last [[White Tree of Gondor]]. It died at the same time as [[Belecthor II]] the twenty-first [[Ruling Steward]].<ref>{{App

column1: For lack of a seedling, the Dead Tree was left standing in the [[Court of the Fountain (Minas Tirith)
column2: Court of the Fountain]] of [[Minas Tirith]] "until the King comes".<ref>{{PM
column3: Elendil}}, p. 206</ref>. It stood throughout the following centuries and the [[War of the Ring]]. That was until King [[Aragorn
column4: Aragorn Elessar]] found a new seedling on [[Mindolluin

column1: When it was replaced, it was removed from the court but was placed in the [[Rath Dínen
column2: Tombs of the Kings]] with all the honour that would normally be accorded a fallen [[Kings of Gondor

column1: '''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''

:The film shows the dead tree standing in the court. A close up reveals that it is flowering again during the [[Siege of Gondor]], specifically the scene where [[Denethor]] is preparing to cremate himself and [[Faramir]]. During the wedding of Aragorn and [[Arwen]], the tree is seen fully blossomed.
